questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

A wholesale company is implementing finance and operations apps.

The business-to-business (B2B) and business-to-consumer (B2C) customers must be able to purchase in-person through two sales channels: warehouse or pop-up shops.

The B2B operations require automatic post and settlement of accounts receivable for cash sales.

The B2C operations require consolidated consumer sales per sales channel.

You need to configure the solutions.

Which solutions should you configure? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

comments.content: Agree. Payment is core financial processes

discussion.content:
Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management often includes functionalities related to sales, accounts receivable, and settlements, including the handling of cash sales. However, it's worth noting that Dynamics 365 Finance (part of the broader Finance and Operations suite) is usually responsible for the core financial processes, including accounts receivable and cash management.

While Dynamics 365 Commerce can integrate with other Dynamics 365 applications for comprehensive retail solutions, the automatic post and settlement of accounts receivable are more closely associated with the finance and accounting functionalities of Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations.

questions.question_text:
A company that uses Dynamics 365 Finance has a new data entry team.

The data entry team creates multiple records for a single contact.

You need to recommend methods to minimize creation of multiple contacts that are the same.

Which two options should you recommend? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.D: Assign parties in the global address book.
choices.B: Check for duplicates on the global address book list page.
choices.A: Set the Check for duplicate parameter.
choices.C: Set the Delete parties with no roles parameter.
choices.E: Set the secure by address book parameter.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A and B
Option D is false, because assigning parties in the global address book will not prevent the creation of duplicate contacts. It will only associate the parties with one or more address books, which are collections of parties that share some characteristics
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/basics/merge-duplicate-records-accounts-contacts-leads?view=op-9-1

Selected Answer: AB
AB is correct

comments.content: I agree that E is not correct.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
I would choose 
A - because that will give a warning when a user creates a new record that a duplicate exists.
B - Check for duplicates, in order to mitigate already created ones.

E Set the secure by address book parameter prohibits certain user groups to access sensitive address information. I don't see how this could stop creating duplicates.

choices.A: Associate the global address book party to the US company.
choices.D: Set the secure by address book parameter.

Creating an intercompany relationship helps establish connections and access between legal entities within the same organization, allowing for shared data and collaboration across entities. In this case, it would enable the US entity to access the vendor's information from the Canada entity, including sales representative details for order placement.

Options A, C, and D do not directly address the requirement for intercompany access to vendor information between the US and Canada legal entities in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management.

questions.question_text:
A company uses Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. The company has two legal entities, one in the United States and one in Canada.

The Canada entity has a vendor that the US entity wants to order from directly. The US entity requires access to the vendor sales representative information for order placement.

You need to resolve the US access requirement.

What should you do?

DRAG DROP
-

A company implements finance and operations apps.

The company needs to implement distributed order management and fixed assets capabilities.

You need to identify the apps to implement.

Which apps should you recommend? To answer, drag the appropriate apps to the correct capabilities. Each app may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution. Determine whether the solution meets the stated goals. You are a Dynamics 365 Finance sales manager. You use a Power BI dashboard that shows near-real-time sales data from reports and tiles.
It is impractical to keep switching between multiple applications.
You need to configure a way to access the Power BI reports within the Dynamics 365 Finance client.
Solution: Include the Power BI reports in a Power BI App and pin the Power BI App to your workspace.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Pinning Power BI content to the client
PowerBI.com can be used on its own as a reporting and dashboard solution for your organization or business unit. However, users can also pin tiles and reports from their own PowerBI.com accounts to workspaces. Power BI content in Dynamics 365 provides contextual insights that are related to business operations.

You can pin two types of objects from PowerBI.com: tiles in PowerBI.com dashboards, and reports.

Before you can pin Power BI content, you must configure Power BI in your Dynamics 365 environment.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/analytics/power-bi-integration?context=%2Fdynamics365%2Fcontext%2Fcommerce#pinning-power-bi-content-to-the-client
Correct. PowerBi.com account will integrate not the App
